meanings.definition: a machine that automatically plays a selected musical recording when a coin is inserted
meanings.sent1: At the diner, the jukebox played my favorite song when I put in a coin.
meanings.sent2: The jukebox in the corner of the room played a mix of old and new songs.
meanings.sent3: The jukebox seemed to have a mind of its own, playing songs at random times.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was like a jukebox, effortlessly playing different tunes for different moods.
meanings.sent5: The jukebox hummed to life, filling the room with nostalgic melodies.

meanings.definition: to play music on a jukebox
meanings.sent1: I love to jukebox my favorite songs whenever I visit the bar.
meanings.sent2: She jukeboxes the latest hits every time she's in charge of the music.
meanings.sent3: He tried to jukebox a symphony on the old jukebox, but it only played pop songs.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers danced on the jukebox buttons, creating a melody that filled the room.
meanings.sent5: The DJ decided to jukebox the party, letting the crowd choose the songs they wanted to hear.
